organic_results.title: Teacher perceptions, parental social status and grouping for reading instruction
organic_results.snippet: This study examines the argument that teachers' perceptions of their students are influenced by the family background of those students, and that these perceptions, in turn, affect students' curricular placement. The comments of 37 elementary teachers engaged in recommending reading group placement for their pupils were collected and classified. These comments most often reflected achievement-related criteria and were generally related to pupil reading test scores more strongly than to student SES. Regression analyses …

publication_info.summary: EJ Haller, SA Davis - Sociology of Education, 1981 - JSTOR
